One of the (b)…… of methane is that it only survives a few hundred years. This means that something, somewhere on Mars, is replenishing the supply. (c)…….. NASA, Mars emits thousands of tons of methane at a time. The level of methane rises and (d)…… at seasonal intervals in the year, almost (e)……the planet is breathing it. (Da learnenglish.britishcounsil.com) 
Which of the following words correctly completes the blank space marked with the letter (c)?
Correct Answer Message: Analizzando le opzioni e il testo proposto, si può capire come vada completata la frase: si deve inserire una preposizione che indichi il fatto che si stiano riportando delle informazioni. L’opzione più appropriata e corretta grammaticalmente è la A. L’opzione D sarebbe altrettanto grammaticalmente corretta ma, oltre ad essere molto formale, in genere adotta il significato di “in conformità con” o “ai sensi di”, diversamente da "according to" che si traduce con "secondo" e "a detta di".
Subject: Inglese

Question:
The rover analyses the air around it (a)…….., and in 2014 it found the air contained another of the most basic organic molecules and a key ingredient of natural gas: methane. One of the (b)…… of methane is that it only survives a few hundred years. This means that something, somewhere on Mars, is replenishing the supply. (c)…….. NASA, Mars emits thousands of tons of methane at a time. The level of methane rises and (d)…… at seasonal intervals in the year, almost (e)……the planet is breathing it. (Da learnenglish.britishcounsil.com) 
Which of the following words correctly completes the blank space marked with the letter (d)?
Correct Answer Message: In questa parte del testo serve inserire un verbo coniugato alla terza persona singolare al simple present, dato che lo spazio all'interno della frase è preceduto da un verbo alla medesima persona e tempo ("rises" = "sale", "aumenta"). L’unico che corrisponde a queste richieste è il verbo indicato nell’opzione E.
Subject: Inglese

Question:
The rover analyses the air around it (a)…….., and in 2014 it found the air contained another of the most basic organic molecules and a key ingredient of natural gas: methane. One of the (b)…… of methane is that it only survives a few hundred years. This means that something, somewhere on Mars, is replenishing the supply. (c)…….. NASA, Mars emits thousands of tons of methane at a time. The level of methane rises and (d)…… at seasonal intervals in the year, almost (e)……the planet is breathing it. (Da learnenglish.britishcounsil.com) 
Which of the following words correctly completes the blank space marked with the letter (e)?
Correct Answer Message: La frase da proposta si completa correttamente solo con la congiunzione “as if”, traducibile con “come se”, che rende la frase di senso compiuto.
Subject: Inglese

Question:
Horror films love (a)……. places. This could be an abandoned hospital, a scary empty house or a ghost town. There's something about lonely, empty places. What (b)…….. like when people lived there? Why did they leave? Maybe it's also that they are so quiet, which can be very scary (c)…….. . Of course, abandoned places are also handy for horror film directors in that it's (d)…….. that you will have no phone coverage there (e)……. . (Da learnenglish.britishcounsil.com) 
Which of the following words correctly completes the blank space marked with the letter (a)?
Correct Answer Message: Analizzando il contesto della frase, è necessario inserire un aggettivo che si adatti all’argomento del testo. Nella frase successiva si parla, infatti, di luoghi abbandonati, e l’aggettivo più adatto tra quelli proposti è “uninhabited” (opzione A), che letteralmente significa “disabitato”.
Subject: Inglese

Question:
Horror films love (a)……. places. This could be an abandoned hospital, a scary empty house or a ghost town. There's something about lonely, empty places. What (b)…….. like when people lived there? Why did they leave? Maybe it's also that they are so quiet, which can be very scary (c)…….. . Of course, abandoned places are also handy for horror film directors in that it's (d)…….. that you will have no phone coverage there (e)……. . (Da learnenglish.britishcounsil.com) 
Which of the following words correctly completes the blank space marked with the letter (b)?
Correct Answer Message: Lo spazio da riempire si trova all'interno di una frase interrogativa, perciò è necessario che il verbo sia anteposto al soggetto e ciò avviene solo nelle opzioni C ed E. Nell’opzione C, tuttavia, il tempo verbale è il simple present e, dato che nel resto della frase si ritrova il simple past, si deve escludere questa alternativa in favore dell'alternativa E, che rappresenta la risposta corretta.
Subject: Inglese

Question:
Horror films love (a)……. places. This could be an abandoned hospital, a scary empty house or a ghost town. There's something about lonely, empty places. What (b)…….. like when people lived there? Why did they leave? Maybe it's also that they are so quiet, which can be very scary (c)…….. . Of course, abandoned places are also handy for horror film directors in that it's (d)…….. that you will have no phone coverage there (e)……. . (Da learnenglish.britishcounsil.com) 
Which of the following words correctly completes the blank space marked with the letter (c)?
Correct Answer Message: Nella frase serve inserire un avverbio che abbia significato di aggiunta. L’unica opzione adatta è “too”, nell’opzione D. Ci sono anche altri avverbi adatti a questo contesto, come “also” (senza as che lo precede o lo succede) o “as well” che tuttavia non sono presenti tra le opzioni.
Subject: Inglese

Question:
Horror films love (a)……. places. This could be an abandoned hospital, a scary empty house or a ghost town. There's something about lonely, empty places. What (b)…….. like when people lived there? Why did they leave? Maybe it's also that they are so quiet, which can be very scary (c)…….. . Of course, abandoned places are also handy for horror film directors in that it's (d)…….. that you will have no phone coverage there (e)……. . (Da learnenglish.britishcounsil.com) 
Which of the following words correctly completes the blank space marked with the letter (d)?
Correct Answer Message: In questo caso è necessario l'utilizzo di un comparativo di maggioranza, che viene proposto unicamente dalle alternative A e B. Si comprende dal senso della frase che serva un aggettivo, e non un avverbio: ciò permette dunque di scartare definitivamente l'opzione A. La traduzione della frase è infatti: "I luoghi abbandonati sono anche pratici per i registi del film horror dal momento che risulta più credibile che lì non si abbia nemmeno campo."
Subject: Inglese

Question:
Horror films love (a)……. places. This could be an abandoned hospital, a scary empty house or a ghost town. There's something about lonely, empty places. What (b)…….. like when people lived there? Why did they leave? Maybe it's also that they are so quiet, which can be very scary (c)…….. . Of course, abandoned places are also handy for horror film directors in that it's (d)…….. that you will have no phone coverage there (e)……. . (Da learnenglish.britishcounsil.com) 
Which of the following words correctly completes the blank space marked with the letter (e)?
Correct Answer Message: In questa frase, negativa, è necessario inserire un avverbio adatto ad essere posto alla fine della proposizione. Tra le alternative, l’unica corretta è “either”, che tradotto nel contesto vuol dire “nemmeno”, "neanche".
Subject: Inglese

Question: European Union was founded in 1957 during the Treaty of Rome and it came into force from the beginning of the next year. At the beginning there were just 6 countries joined this treaty, but in all these years other ones were included in it, now they are 27. This organisation was founded as a political and economical union, due to increase the welfare and reduce differences between the members. According to the text, how many country form the EU?
Correct Answer Message: Nel passaggio viene specificato che all’inizio solo 6 stati entrarono a far parte dell’Unione Europea ma nel corso degli anni se ne aggiunsero altri fino ad arrivare a 27.
Subject: Inglese

Question: According to the recent short film produced by Barilla®, the most copied and sabotaged recipe, carbonara, was born in the centre of Italy, during last years of the WWII. There are different theories about its origins but one of the most accredited is that it was created to create something that would have united Italy culinary traditions with American soldiers’ tastes. That’s the reason why there is the chance that carbonara was firstly created with the use of bacon instead of guanciale, which is, following the recipe, the correct ingredient. According to the text, which one of the following is the correct ingredient of carbonara?
Correct Answer Message: Nel testo viene specificato che, seppur ci siano dubbi sull’originale ricetta, l’ingrediente che si deve utilizzare per realizzare la carbonara è il guanciale.
Subject: Inglese

Question: Michael Keaton is a great American actor, known for his interpretations in many films such as Batman by Tim Burton, The Founder or the most recent Birdman (or The Unexpected Virtue of Ignorance). However, even if we know him as Keaton, his real surname is Douglas. Reading about this name, we suddenly think about another great actor, Michael Douglas. Behind the story about this case of homonymy there’s Douglas’ father, Kirk (1916-2020), whose real name was Issur Danielovich, who decided to change his surname in Douglas in order to have a most simple and American one, and so his son Michael keep it. When, some years later, the original Michael Douglas started his career in Hollywood, he suddenly understood that there could not exist two Michael Douglas in the cinema industry, so he decided to change his surname into Keaton. According to the text, which one of the following statements is correct?
Option (a): Michael Keaton, born Douglas, changed his surname
Option (b): Kirk changed his name into Keaton
Option (c): Michael Douglas, born Danielovich, changed his surname again in Keaton
Option (d): Michael Keaton, born Danielovich, changed his surname
Option (e): Issur Danielovich changed his name in Kirk Keaton
Correct Answer Message: Da testo si evince che Michael Keaton, nato Michael Douglas, ha cambiato il cognome in Keaton perché c’era già un altro attore noto a lui omonimo quando iniziò a recitare.
Subject: Inglese

Question: “They call Sollozzo "the Turk". Two reasons. He’s spent a lot of time in Turkey and is supposed to have a Turkish wife and kids. Second. He’s supposed to be very quick with the knife, or was, when he was young. Only in matters of business, though, and with some sort of reasonable complaint. A very competent man and his own boss. He has a record, he’s done two terms in prison, one in Italy, one in the United States, and he’s known to the authorities as a narcotics man. This could be a plus for us. It means that he’ll never get immunity to testify, since he’s considered the top and, of course, because of his record. Also he has an American wife and three children and he is a good family man. He’ll stand still for any rap as long as he knows that they will be well taken care of for living money.” (Da “Il Padrino” di Mario Puzo, 1969) According to the description of the character, how many wives does Sollozzo have?
Option (c): Two wives, the first one from Turkey and the second one from America
Correct Answer Message: Leggendo la descrizione del personaggio di Sollozzo si evince che abbia due mogli, una di origini turche e l’altra invece americana.
Subject: Inglese

Question: 1927 representatives of the film industry in the United States founded the Academy of Arts and Science of Cinema. At the opening, an annual prize was proposed for the best film, director and actor, nowadays knows simply as “Oscar” but originally named Academy Award of Merit. The origins of the name come from the design of the statue: Cecil Gibbons drew on the tablecloth a statue that had a sword in the chest and the realisation was entrusted to the sculptor George Stanley. The legend says that Margaret Herrik, a secretary of the College, saw the award of 1929 and said: 'It looks like my Uncle Oscar!' According to the text, who drew the statue?
Correct Answer Message: Nel testo si può leggere che l’ideazione della statuetta è opera di Cecil Gibbons, che la disegnò su un tovagliolo. Fu poi realizzata dallo scultore George Stanley.
Subject: Inglese

Question: Even if it sounds strange, Queen Elizabeth II celebrates her birthday twice a year: the first time on April 21, the second time in June. This tradition comes from the will of King Edward VII, born in November, whose “public” birthday was changed and set during the summer in order to celebrate it on a sunny day. In fact, every year on the second Saturday of June, there is the traditional parade in Buckingham Palace. According to the text, when is the Queen's public birthday celebrated?
Option (d): On the second Saturday of June
Correct Answer Message: Nelle ultime righe del testo si legge che il giorno prefissato per il festeggiamento pubblico del sovrano del Regno Unito è stato scelto per il secondo sabato del mese di giugno.
Subject: Inglese

Question: Prosopagnosia is a cognitive disorder in which the ability to recognise familiar faces is impaired. This disease is mainly caused by a brain damage but it can be congenital or a consequence of development of other disorders. Patients with this disease base the recognition on the presence of specific details, like the voice or the haircut, that they associate to someone they know. Oliver Sacks wrote an essay, “The Man Who Mistook His Wife For a Hat”, where he collected the stories of patients he treated during his career as a neurologist. According to the text, whichn one of the following options is not a cause of prosopagnosia?
Correct Answer Message: Dal testo si comprende che il manifestarsi della prosopagnosia può essere già presente alla nascita ma può essere causato anche da danni cerebrali, come ad esempio un trauma cranico, o l’aggravarsi di patologie già presenti. Le cause psicologiche non sono citate nel testo e non sono state finora associate alla patologia.
Subject: Inglese

Question:
In 1296 the Florence Cathedral was begun following the design of Arnolfo di Cambio, but it was completed only 140 years later with the dome designed by Filippo Brunelleschi. The dome, which includes also the baptistery and Giotto’s bell tower, is one of the greatest churches in Europe and destination for million of tourists from all over the world every year. Reading the passage, in which year did the works on the cathedral end? 
?
Correct Answer Message: Nel testo viene citato l’anno di inizio della costruzione, 1296, e quanto tempo sia stato impiegato per terminare la costruzione, 140 anni: da queste informazioni si ricava che l’anno in cui vennero terminati i lavori sia il 1436. Le decorazioni esterne del duomo vennero completate solo nel 1887, ma per rispondere alla domanda bisogna basarsi esclusivamente sul testo dato.
Subject: Inglese

Question: Prince William launched an unprecedented attack on the BBC on a Thursday night, after an official inquiry found a 26-year-old interview with his mother Princess Diana had been obtained deceitfully and unethically. The Duke of Cambridge condemned what he called the “lurid and false claims” made by then-BBC journalist Martin Bashir in order to gain access to the princess for the 1995 interview, in which she opened up about the collapse of her marriage to Prince Charles. “The deceitful way the interview was obtained substantially influenced what my mother said,” William said, and “was a major contribution to making my parents’ relationship worse.” (Da time.com “Princes William and Harry Have Slammed the BBC Over a 1995 Interview With Princess Diana. Here's Why”, maggio 2021) According to the text, what is the accuse that Prince William has moved to the journalist of BBC?
Option (a): He thinks that the journalist is responsible for the accident that caused Diana’s death
Option (b): He thinks that the journalist made Diana say false accusations against the Royal Family
Option (c): He thinks that the way the journalist conducted the interview influenced Diana’s words
Option (d): He thinks that the journalist was Diana’s lover
Option (e): He thinks that the journalist is the man who caused the end of Diana and Prince Charles marriage
Correct Answer Message: Nella seconda parte del testo si possono leggere le parole del Principe William stesso contro il giornalista della BBC, da queste si evince l’accusa mossa: ritiene che il modo in cui venne tenuta l’intervista abbia influenzato sostanzialmente le parole della madre e ciò abbia solo contribuito a peggiorare la relazione tra i genitori.
Subject: Inglese

Question: A Plastic Ocean is a film to make you think. Think, and then act. We need to take action on our dependence on plastic. We've been producing plastic in huge quantities since the 1940s. Drink bottles, shopping bags, toiletries and even clothes are made with plastic. We live in a world full of plastic, and only a small proportion is recycled. What happens to all the rest? This is the question the film A Plastic Ocean answers. It is a documentary that looks at the impact that plastic waste has on the environment. Spoiler alert: the impact is devastating. (Da learnenglish.britishcouncil.org, “A Plastic Ocean, a film review”) Reading the text, when did we start producing huge quantities of plastic?
Option (a): We are not producing huge quantities of plastic
Option (c): We have always procuced huge quantities of plastic
Correct Answer Message: Nelle prime parole del testo si legge come l'uomo abbia iniziato a produrre ingenti quantità di plastica dagli anni Quaranta e come da lì in poi il quantitativo sia aumentato.
Subject: Inglese

Question: Thanks to the field of linguistics we know much about the development of the 5,000 plus languages in existence today. We can describe their grammar and pronunciation and see how their spoken and written forms have changed over time. For example, we understand the origins of the Indo-European group of languages, which includes Norwegian, Hindi and English, and can trace them back to tribes in eastern Europe in about 3000 BC. So, we have mapped out a great deal of the history of language, but there are still areas we know little about. Experts are beginning to look to the field of evolutionary biology to find out how the human species developed to be able to use language. So far, there are far more questions and half-theories than answers. How many languages are known to exist?
Correct Answer Message: Grazie agli studi approfonditi di linguistica sono state identificate oltre 5000 lingue esistenti.
Subject: Inglese

Question: Stan Lee is one of the most known character in the world of comics: he is responsible for some of the most famous superheroes ever created, such as Spider-Man, Iron Man but also Thor and the X-Men. One of the things he is known for is the countless appearances he has made in Marvel-produced films. In fact, there are 39 cameos attributed to him, the last two in films distributed after his death in 2018. How many cameos has Stan Lee appeared in?
Correct Answer Message: Dal testo si può leggere il totale dei cameo fatti da Stan Lee, ovvero 39.
Subject: Inglese

Question: In my family there are four people born in April: my father, my grandfather, my cousin and my grandmother. Only my other grandfather was born in March and me and my other grandmother celebrate our birthday on the same day in May. My mum and my older cousin were born in October and my sister with my uncle and my aunt celebrate the birthday in September. According to the text, which family memebers celebrate their birthday in May??
Option (a): The father, the grandfather, the cousin and the grandmother
Option (b): The sister, the uncle and the aunt
Option (c): The sister, the mother and the uncle
Correct Answer Message: Nel testo sopra citato l’autore afferma di festeggiare il compleanno lo stesso giorno della nonna, nello specifico nel mese di maggio.
Subject: Inglese

Question: When I was younger I used to go on holiday with my family in a small town in Liguria, in the North-West of Italy, where we rented a house for two or three weeks. We changed our habits when I was twelve, when my parents decided to visit the South of Italy, where they bought a tiny house by the sea. At the beginning I was afraid of the changing but then I met some of my best friends ever right there on holiday. Reading the text, when did the family change their holiday destination?
Correct Answer Message: L’autore afferma che la sua famiglia ha deciso di cambiare la destinazione delle vacanze quando aveva 12 anni e i suoi genitori scelsero una meta non specificata nel sud Italia.
Subject: Inglese

Question: On Tuesday, less than two months later, it happened again. After a male customer grew irate that he could not afford a pack of cigarettes, he repeatedly slammed a sheet of plexiglass with his fists until it shattered, shouting racial slurs as he pummeled the protective barrier, according to Mark Sung, who helps his parents run the store and who shared video of the attack with TIME. “He said, ‘You Chinese motherf-ckers are 100% going to hell, 100% going to hell,’” says the 35-year-old Sung, whose family is Korean. (Da time.com “Racist Slurs, Broken Glass, Then a Return to Business for an Asian-Owned Store Attacked Twice. ‘We Have No Choice.’” 25/05/2021) According to the text, where is Sung’s family from?
Correct Answer Message: In questo breve passaggio viene riferita la testimonianza di una violenza dovuta a discriminazione razziale subita da Sung la cui famiglia è coreana ("Sung, whose family is Korean").
Subject: Inglese

Question: In terms of deaths, damage and inter­national attention, the events in Lod were overshadowed by what unfolded in the Gaza Strip a week later. The militant group Hamas fired rockets from its coastal enclave into Israel, killing at least a dozen people. The Israeli air force responded with airstrikes that left at least 248 dead. For the international community, it was the focal point for an urgent round of diplomacy to deliver the cease-fire that halted the conflict on May 21. (Da time.com “Inside the Israeli City That Sits on the Divide Between Jews and Arabs” 27/05/2021) At least how many people have died due to the Israeli airstrike?
Correct Answer Message: Il testo spiega come siano state uccise almeno 248 persone dalla risposta aerea israeliana, mentre l’offensiva di Hamas ha ucciso 12 persone.
Subject: Inglese

Question: The tensions within Lod have existed since the then-Arab city called Lydda fell to Jewish forces in the 1948 war that founded Israel. Most of the city’s Arab population was expelled, and Jews moved in. When the city fell on hard times in the 1980s, Arabs moved into housing tenements vacated by Jews. Then, about 20 years ago, the Garin members began buying apartments in those neighborhoods too. They describe it as a project of upkeep. “The goal was to attract young religious couples to help the economic situation of the city,” says Frankenburg. (Da time.com “Inside the Israeli City That Sits on the Divide Between Jews and Arabs” 27/05/2021) When did Lydda fall to Jewish forces?
Correct Answer Message: Nel testo si legge che la città di Lydda cadde nelle mani delle forze ebraiche negli scontri del 1948.
Subject: Inglese

Question: If peaceful coexistence in Lod was an illusion before, it is shattered now. Sporadic attacks on Arabs and Jews continued in late May. The Jewish paramilitary operated its War Room with 10 armed volunteers on a rapid-response team and 20 more stationed on rooftop lookouts around Ramat Eshkol. At the centuries-old Great Mosque, Muslims slept inside at night to protect it. “We will return to living together because there is no choice,” says Sheikh Albaz, the imam. (Da time.com “Inside the Israeli City That Sits on the Divide Between Jews and Arabs” 27/05/2021) Who is Sheikh Albaz?
Correct Answer Message: Dalle ultime parole del testo si evince che Sheikh Albaz è l’imam della grande moschea di Ramat Eshkol.
Subject: Inglese

Question: In Jan. 2020, Thailand became the first country outside of China to confirm a case of the disease that became known as COVID-19—but it successfully fought off the pandemic for most of the year, recording less than 5,000 cases in a population of 70 million by mid-December. Now the total has skyrocketed 18-fold to more than 90,000 cases as this onetime COVID success story battles a worrying new surge. (Da time.com “Southeast Asia Kept COVID-19 Under Control For Most of the Pandemic. Now It's Battling Worrying New Surges” 14/05/2021) How many cases does Thailand record now?
Correct Answer Message: In Thailandia si sono verificati nell’ultimo periodo più di 90 mila casi di COVID, al contrario del primo periodo dello scoppio della pandemia quando registrò un numero molto ridotto di casi in proporzione alla popolazione della nazione, pari a 5000.
Subject: Inglese

Question: The prime minister of Vietnam, which has ramped up border checks, said illegal immigrants are among the prime sources of the virus in the country. At least five of Thailand’s recent COVID-19 cases were found in people who slipped across the border from Cambodia, Malaysia and Myanmar. In Cambodia, Erik Karlsson of the virology unit at the Institut Pasteur du Cambodge says the latest outbreak was likely caused by a breach of the country’s strict quarantine measures. (Da time.com “Southeast Asia Kept COVID-19 Under Control For Most of the Pandemic. Now It's Battling Worrying New Surges” 14/05/2021) What is the prime source of virus in Vietnam according to Karlsson?
Correct Answer Message: Secondo Karlsson la causa primaria dell’aumento dei contagi da COVID-19 in Vietnam è la violazione delle misure di quarantena, al contrario di quanto pensa il primo ministro del Paese il quale afferma che la causa principale siano gli immigrati illegali.
Subject: Inglese

Question: Adding to fears are the region’s lagging vaccine rollouts, the result of either a lack of supply, vaccine hesitancy or simply the hope that mitigation measures that have worked reasonably well so far—mask-wearing, testing, contact tracing and social distancing—will continue to do the job. Singapore has vaccinated 30% of its people with at least one dose, making it a leader in Asia’s vaccination race. But in Cambodia, just 12% of people have had at least one dose and in Malaysia, less than 4% of people have received their first jab. Fewer than 2% of people in Thailand and Vietnam have received their first shots. In Laos, less than 6% of people have received their first dose. (Da time.com “Southeast Asia Kept COVID-19 Under Control For Most of the Pandemic. Now It's Battling Worrying New Surges” 14/05/2021) Which one of the following statements is correct?
Option (a): In Cambodia 4% of people have received one dose of vaccine
Option (b): In Thailand 12% of people have received one dose of vaccine
Option (c): In Singapore 30% of people have received one dose of vaccine
Option (d): In Laos 9% of people have received one dose of vaccine
Option (e): In Malaysia 2% of people have received one dose of vaccine
Correct Answer Message: Nei dati riportati dal testo si evince che a Singapore circa il 30% della popolazione ha ricevuto la prima dose di vaccino per il COVID-19.
Subject: Inglese

Question: Ruthie the black Lab knows her mom and dad. Last month was the first time that Kathleen Bourque took Ruthie to the beach after their whole world changed — after dad didn’t come home from Marine Corps training, after the U.S. government packed up all their belongings and shipped them across the country, after she had to insist that she was family, that she belonged right there, next to Conor McDowell’s casket at the funeral. (Da washingtonpost.com “The dog acknowledged they were a couple. The military did not.” 27/05/2021) Which one of the following statements is incorrect?
Option (b): Kathleen is the owner of Ruthie
Option (c): Ruthie’s dad didn’t come home from Marine Corps training
Option (d): Kathleen had to insist with the US government that she is part of the family of her fiancée
Option (e): Ruthie’s dad took her to the beach
Correct Answer Message: L’unica affermazione errata delle opzioni sopra citate è l’ultima, infatti Ruthie non è stata portata in spiaggia dal padrone ("her dad") ma da Kathleen.
Subject: Inglese

Question: The first ever movie trailer reportedly debuted back in 1913, for the musical The Pleasure Seekers. Today, movie trailers have become an industry unto themselves, refining their own formulas to maximize viewer appeal, and even recalling earlier trailers (rather than actual movies) by using the same borrowed music or the same techniques. Now there are even teasers for trailers, which are shortened to suit dwindling attention spans or to try and connect with ticket buyers on a variety of platforms. (Da mentalfloss.com “The 25 Best Movie Trailers of All Time” 26/05/2021) When did the first movie trailer debut?
Correct Answer Message: Dalle prime righe del testo sopra riportato si evince che il primo trailer venne creato nel 1913 per il musical “The Pleasure Seeker”.
Subject: Inglese

Question: When cheeseburger was first mentioned in the October 1938 article, it was in a long list about the "whimsy" of California eateries. Then, nine years later in May 1947, the Times revisited the fad, writing, "At first, the combination of beef with cheese and tomatoes, which sometimes are used, may seem bizarre." Fortunately, their intrepid reporter could see the bigger picture. "If you reflect a bit, you’ll understand the combination is sound gastronomically." Now, more than 80 years after the paper with all the news that's fit to print took notice of the trend, you can not only ask for gourmet cheeses like brie, goat, or gorgonzola on your burger—or spend upwards of $300 on one—but there are many burger chains where you can order stacks on stacks on stacks of cheeseburger patties. (Da mentalfloss.com “In 1938, The New York Times Thought Cheeseburgers Were a Weird New Food Fad” 28/05/2021) Reading the text, when was the cheeseburger mentioned in a journal for the first time?
Correct Answer Message: All'inizio del testo si legge che il cheeseburger venne citato per la prima volta da un giornale nell’ottobre del 1938.
Subject: Inglese

Question: Depending on the flavour, ice cream can also contain ingredients that can prompt even more serious reactions in dogs. Real sugar isn’t well-tolerated—it can promote weight gain—and a sugar substitute like xylitol is actually toxic. So is chocolate. The caffeine in coffee or tea-flavored ice cream can also prompt a bad reaction, and the same goes for varieties that include macadamia nuts or raisins. All of these ingredients are bad for dogs on their own and might be easily overlooked when handing them a cone or popsicle to lick. If you want to give your dog a cool treat, there are other options. Blending and freezing bananas can make for a safe snack; so can fat-free plain (not sweetened or frozen) yogurt. You can also track down ice cream made specifically for dogs. Ben & Jerry’s has two flavors, the pumpkin-flavored Rosie’s Batch and the peanut-butter-and-pretzel Pontch’s Mix, available at retailers. They use sunflower seed butter instead of dairy, though they do contain sugar. (Da mentalfloss.com “Can Dogs Eat Ice Cream?” 27/05/2021) According to the text, which of the following substances is not toxic to dogs?
Correct Answer Message: Nel testo vengono elencate una serie di sostanze che sono nocive per i cani, ma anche altre adatte alla loro alimentazione. Delle alternative proposte, solo la banana non è nociva per i cani.
Subject: Inglese

Question: When the city of Florence first commissioned Michelangelo to sculpt David, it was supposed to be one of many statues to line the roof of the Florence Cathedral dome. But the statue was so well-received when it was completed in 1504 that it was decided that it needed to be more visible to people. Plus, at 17 feet tall and weighing 6.4 tons, moving it onto the roof wouldn’t have been an easy task. The decision was then made to display it outside the Palazzo Vecchio, Florence’s government offices, where it stood for nearly 370 years before moving to the Galleria dell'Accademia (the Gallery of the Academy of Florence) in 1873, which is where he still stands today. (Da mentalfloss.com “Michelangelo”) How long did David stand in front of the Palazzo Vecchio?
Correct Answer Message: Il David di Michelangelo venne posizionato davanti a Palazzo Vecchio per 370 anni, fino a quando venne spostato all’interno della Galleria dell’Accademia nel 1873.
Subject: Inglese

Question: Pietà, which depicts Mary cradling the body of Jesus after the Crucifixion, is one of Michelangelo’s best-known works. The sculpture is notable beyond just being a masterpiece from the artist—it’s also reportedly the only work Michelangelo ever signed. So what made Michelangelo's Pietà so different from his other works that he just had to sign it? Apparently, he overheard onlookers admiring the statue as a work in progress, but when one of them asked who the artist was, someone in the group attributed it to a different sculptor. Michelangelo, horrified by the onlooker’s mixup, returned to the statue one night and chiseled his name across Mary’s chest—an act he would later regret and led him to vow that he would never sign another piece of work. (Da mentalfloss.com “Michelangelo”) How many sculptures did Michelangelo sign?
Correct Answer Message: Michelangelo firmò la Pietà perché si sentì offeso dal fatto che un passante attribuì l'opera ad un altro autore, tuttavia se ne pentì e da lì in poi non firmò nessun’altra opera.
Subject: Inglese

Question: In 1990, a physician from Indiana named Dr. Frank Lynn Meshberger came up with a new interpretation of The Creation of Adam, which is the most recognizable portion of the Sistine Chapel ceiling. His theory is that the rose-colored fabric that surrounds God and Eve in the painting represents the human brain, due to its distinct shape. He also pointed to other details that can be found within, such as a green scarf standing in for the vertebral artery and an angel’s foot and leg forming what looks like the pituitary stalk and gland. (Da mentalfloss.com “Michelangelo”) What does the green scarf represent in The Creation of Adam?
Correct Answer Message: La sciarpa verde rappresentata nell’affresco, secondo il Dr. Meshberger, rappresenta l’arteria vertebrale.
Subject: Inglese

Question: Pulling up to their nearest grocery store or supermarket, shoppers will often see large windows spread across the front entrance. But once inside, natural light all but disappears. Stores rarely have windows along walls, near the front, or skylights. What gives? The lack of windows is a component of retail shopping psychology, where retailers try to create an environment where people feel comfortable to spend both time and money. It’s why many stores have tile floors, which cause carts to make a lot of noise—forcing shoppers to instinctively slow down and browse more, or why stores may play up-tempo music when a store is busy to speed shoppers up. (Da mentalfloss.com “The Reason You Rarely See Windows in Grocery Stores” 16/05/2021) Which one of the following techniques is used in supermarkets?
Option (c): Tiles that cause carts to make noise
Option (e): The organisation of the departments of the supermarket
Correct Answer Message: Tra tutte le opzioni elencate, l’unica che viene citata dal testo come elemento utilizzato nei supermercati per favorire l’acquisto da parte dei clienti è l’utilizzo di piastrelle che a contatto con le ruote dei carrelli fanno rumore. Questa tecnica infatti fa in modo che il cliente rallenti nel percorso all’interno del negozio e che si concentri di più sui prodotti.
Subject: Inglese

Question: But when you go to a hotel, there’s not often a lot of variety. The comforter may be colorful, but the sheets and towels are almost always white—a bright, high-wattage white. Considering the fact that hotel whites see a lot of wear, it’s a curious choice. And while it may make it easier to spot bedbugs, that’s hardly the reason why. Hotels like to use white sheets because they can quickly and easily communicate cleanliness. Imagine climbing into a bed with darker sheets. You may wonder about things you can’t see. With white, you’re assured the sheets have been freshly-laundered. (Da mentalfloss.com “The Reason Hotel Sheets and Towels Are Almost Always White” 10/05/2021) According to the text, why are hotel sheets and towels always white?
Option (b): Because they are matched with the furniture
Option (d): Because they are easier to wash
Correct Answer Message: Nel testo si può leggere come la scelta degli asciugamani sia spesso volta verso il colore bianco perché questo trasmette più facilmente l’idea di pulizia, al contrario invece dei colori più scuri.
Subject: Inglese

Question: Today, the word blockbuster is usually associated with movies, whether you're talking about a film that achieved massive success at the box office or a certain defunct video rental chain. Though its meaning is innocuous now, back in the 1940s, it was used to describe something much darker. According to TIME, the original blockbusters were large, highly destructive bombs used during World War II. The magazine first printed the word in a November 29, 1942, article about an Allied bombing in Italy; the nickname came from the weapon's ability to decimate entire city blocks. As the British Royal Air Force continued to drop the bombs throughout the war, the name caught on, and it was soon used to refer to anything particularly explosive or extravagant.(Da mentalfloss.com “Why Do We Call Hit Movies Blockbusters?” 28/04/2021) Which is the first journal that used the word “blockbuster”?
Correct Answer Message: Il primo giornale ad utilizzare  la parola “blockbuster” fu il TIME nel 1942 per riferirsi alla notevole distruzione delle bombe degli alleati sul territorio italiano.
Subject: Inglese

Question: Steven Spielberg's Jaws (1975) is widely considered the first summer blockbuster, but Hollywood's connection to the word predates it by a few decades. Before blockbuster connoted box office success, it described any bold or noteworthy production. In 1943, TIME wrote, "critics decided that Mission to Moscow is as explosive as a blockbuster," in reference to the controversial political thriller. By the mid-1950s, producer Max E. Youngstein had defined a blockbuster as any movie that grossed over $2 million, and United Artists was aiming to release at least one blockbuster per month. (Da mentalfloss.com “Why Do We Call Hit Movies Blockbusters?” 28/04/2021) What is the first film to be considered a blockbuster?
Correct Answer Message: Jaws, in Italia poi tradotto in “Lo Squalo”, fu il primo film ad essere definito un blockbuster. Questo termine venne adottato anche per il film Missione a Mosca in quanto produzione degna di nota, non per il significato ora attribuito a “blockbuster”. Le alternative C e D non vengono nominate nel testo, la E invece propone il nome di un produttore cinematografico.
Subject: Inglese

Question: You may have heard the myth that white-feathered chickens always lay white eggs and brown chickens lay brown eggs. While it's true that a chicken's colouring can say something about its eggs, you shouldn't be looking at the feathers exclusively. The colour of a hen's earlobes is actually the best indicator of what colour its eggs will be. Look at the flap of skin on a chicken's head beneath where an external ear would be: if it's white, the chicken's eggs will likely be white, and if it's darker, they will likely be brown. This trick even works for Araucana chickens, which have green-blue earlobes and lay matching eggs. This should be used as just a rule of thumb, however, as there are exceptions to the pattern. (Da mentalfloss.com “Brown Eggs vs. White Eggs: What’s the Difference?” 8/04/2021) Choose the correct option:
Option (a): the colour of the eggs only depends on the chicken's colouring
Option (b): the colour of a hen’s earlobes is a good indicator for the colour of the eggs
Option (c): the colour of a hen’s eyes reflects the colour of the eggs
Option (d): the length of a chicken's legs influences the colour of the eggs
Option (e): the colour of the beak of the chickens reflects the colour of the eggs
Correct Answer Message: Il colore dei lobi delle orecchie ("earlobes") delle galline è un ottimo indicatore del colore delle uova che verranno deposte. La risposta A non è esatta perché il colore della gallina non riflette sempre quello delle uova.
Subject: Inglese

Question: According to the American Kennel Club, dogs sometimes yawn as a way to calm down. Next time you see your dog yawning excessively, assess the situation they're in. Maybe your dog is frustrated trying to learn a new trick, or anxious about a visitor in your home. They can also become overstimulated by things they enjoy, such as playtime or the prospect of a walk. A good yawn, canine behaviorists say, may help dogs regulate their mood. Yawns can be a form of communication in times of stress as well. If your dog is struggling with a game or training session, a yawn may be their way of telling you they need a break. In some scenarios, dogs may yawn as a way to diffuse conflict. If your pet yawns in the presence of a new dog or person, they may be signaling that they're not a threat. (Da mentalfloss.com “Why Do Dog Yawn?” 1/04/2021) What does dogs yawn means?
Option (e): They want to go to the park
Correct Answer Message: Il testo afferma che, al contrario da ciò che si potrebbe immaginare, i cani sbadigliano per calmarsi a causa di una situazione stressante o perché agitati dalla presenza di persone nuove.
Subject: Inglese

Question: Like the whiskers of dogs, seals, and other animals, feline facial hair isn’t just for decoration. The technical term for whiskers is vibrissae, from the Latin word for vibrate, which tells you a little about what cats use them for. As Purina explains, each whisker is an extra thick hair with a sensory organ called a proprioceptor on the end of it. That proprioceptor picks up vibrations and air currents around a cat and relays those messages to the brain via nerves in the hair follicle. Not only do air currents change when something moves—when you enter a room, for example, or when a dog approaches on the sidewalk—but their patterns also help a cat judge the size, shape, and distance of stationary objects, like furniture. (Da mentalfloss.com “Why Do Cats Have Whiskers?” 11/03/2021) What is the technical term for whiskers?
Correct Answer Message: Il termine tecnico che indica i baffi dei gatti è vibrissae, che viene dal latino.
Subject: Inglese

Question: Though the exact number can vary, most cats have 24 whiskers on their cheeks (12 on each). But it’s not the only place cats have whiskers; less conspicuous ones can be found around their chin, near their ears, above their eyes, and behind their forelegs. Considering how much cats rely on their whiskers, you definitely shouldn’t trim them. But it is normal for whiskers to occasionally fall out on their own, and they will grow back. If your cat seems to be losing more whiskers than normal, it could be caused by an allergic reaction, an infection, or stress. In that case, you should take your cat for a visit to the vet. (Da mentalfloss.com “Why Do Cats Have Whiskers?” 11/03/2021) Where can’t the whiskers be found?
Correct Answer Message: Nel testo vengono citate varie parti del corpo dei gatti dove si possono trovare i loro particolari baffi, la coda non è tra queste.
Subject: Inglese

Question: In the late 19th century it was difficult to make large bathtubs because of the expense involved—though cost wasn't the only thing governing typical tub size. People were a little smaller, too. And baths tended to be made with cast iron, so they were heavy and difficult to move. (Contemporary bathtubs are often made from fiber-reinforced plastic.) It was when production building took off in the early 20th century that a “cookie-cutter approach” to housing standardized the size of the domestic bath, Cressman says. Bathrooms were approximately 5 feet by 7 feet, with the tub—typically measuring 5 feet in length and 32 inches in width—placed along the smaller wall. The bathtub's mass-produced dimensions have always presupposed the size of a person, and excluded those shaped differently. (Da mentalfloss.com “Why Are Bathtubs So Small? The Answer Is More Complex Than You Might Imagine” 10/03/2021) What were the dimensions of the bathrooms in the late 19th century?
Correct Answer Message: Alla fine del diciannovesimo secolo le dimensioni approssimative dei bagni erano intorno ai 5 piedi x 7 piedi.
Subject: Inglese

Question: While you may assume snow that’s freshly fallen and collected in an undisturbed area—even a cup set out for that purpose—is free of any contaminants, don’t be so sure. According to meteorologist Mary Scarzello Fairbanks, who spoke with Prevention, snow isn't all that pristine. It's formed when water droplets freeze around some dust or debris in the air, forming an ice crystal that continues to collect water vapor and form a snowflake. When it falls, it will also collect things hanging in the air, from dirt to bacterial particles to soot. Depending on the region, snow could also contain sulfates, nitrates, formaldehyde, mercury, or pesticides. If it’s windy, snow could even mix with dirt kicked up from the soil before settling. A 2015 study published in the journal Environmental Science: Processes & Impacts even demonstrated how snow could mix with gasoline exhaust. (Da mentalfloss.com “Is It Safe to Eat Snow?” 5/03/2021) According to the text, which one of the following substances cannot be found in snow?
Correct Answer Message: Nel testo vengono elencate una serie di sostanze che si possono trovare nella neve e che possono essere nocive, tra queste il sale non viene citato.
Subject: Inglese

Question: The solution to this winter calamity is typically sodium chloride, or rock salt, which quickly breaks up ice and creates traction. It’s an easy fix, but unfortunately, spreading salt and other ice melters on concrete driveways can have some unforeseen consequences. Salt and de-icers work not by melting ice but by lowering the freezing point of water, which is 32°F. Depending on the chemical used, the freezing point could drop to 20°F or even -25°F. (If you’ve used a de-icer to no apparent effect, then it’s because it was simply too cold and remained below the chemical’s freezing point.) (Da mentalfloss.com “The Reason You Should Never Spread Rock Salt on Concrete Driveways” 24/02/2021) What is the function of the salt spread on the streets?
Option (b): It lowers the freezing point of water
Correct Answer Message: Il sale, spesso utilizzato sulle strade quando nevica, agisce abbassando la temperatura di solidificazione dell’acqua e quindi sfavorendo la formazione di ghiaccio.
Subject: Inglese

Question: In addition to being a handy heads-up, kneeling to propose presumably has roots in some age-old historical practice—or a combination of several. As MarthaStewart.com points out, people have been genuflecting (derived from Latin for “bending the knee”) to show respect or reverence for thousands of years. It may have originated in the Persian Empire, when proper salutations depended on societal rank. “In the case where one is a little inferior to the other, the kiss is given on the cheek,” Greek historian Herodotus observed in Persia around 430 BCE. “Where the difference of rank is great, the inferior prostrates himself upon the ground.” (Da mentalfloss.com “Why Do People Propose on One Knee?” 22/01/2021) Where does the tradition of kneeling come from?
Correct Answer Message: Le origini della tradizione di inginocchiarsi in segno di rispetto ha origine dall’impero persiano, come riportato dallo storico greco Erodoto.
Subject: Inglese

Question: As Live Science explains, white noise is a combination of all the sound frequencies humans can hear—about 20 to 20,000 hertz—played at the same amplitude. Frequency, which essentially describes how many times a wave repeats itself per second, determines how high- or low-pitched a sound is. Amplitude, or the height of each wave, corresponds to volume. Picture a piano with a separate key for every single pitch a human can hear; if you could hit all those keys repeatedly with exactly the same force (so no single key was louder than another), you’d have something akin to white noise. (Da mentalfloss.com “What Exactly Is White Noise?” 6/02/2021) What is the range of frequencies that humans can hear?
Correct Answer Message: La frequenza sonora udibile all’orecchio umano è approssimativamente compresa tra 20 e 20.000 Hertz (20k vuol dire 20.000).
Subject: Inglese

Question: Back in the 15th century, the word inoculate referred to grafting a bud (or another plant part) onto a separate plant in order to cultivate that new plant. It derived from the Latin verb inoculāre, meaning to graft or to implant, which itself derived from the Latin noun for eye or bud: oculus. Over time, people started using it for just about anything implantable, literal or figurative; you could, for example, inoculate an idea into someone else’s mind. So when British physicians began experimenting with implanting smallpox pathogens into unafflicted patients in the 18th century, it made sense to call it “inoculation.” The process, which had long been practiced in Africa and Asia, involved transferring part of a smallpox blister into an open cut on a healthy person, so their immune system could learn how to fend off the disease without being overwhelmed by it. Since variola was the virus that caused smallpox, inoculation was sometimes called “variolation,” too. (Da mentalfloss.com “Vaccination vs. Immunization vs. Inoculation: What's the Difference?” 3/02/2021) When did British physicians start to implant smallpox pathogens into unafflicted patients?
Correct Answer Message: Nel testo si evince che i medici britannici iniziarono a sperimentare l’inoculazione di agenti patogeni in pazienti non affetti dalla malattia a partire dal XVIII secolo.
Subject: Inglese

Question: If you started out as the blondest kid in your kindergarten class and became a brunette by high school, you’re not the only one. As people get older, their hair often gets darker. According to IFLScience, this is due to changes in the production of melanin—the natural pigments responsible for hair, eye, and skin color. Two types of melanin are common: Eumelanin determines how dark your hair is, while pheomelanin controls how warm it is. In other words, black-haired people produce the most eumelanin, and red-haired people produce the most pheomelanin. Melanocytes are the cells located at the bottom of each hair follicle that actually create those pigments, and they take their cues from your genes. (Da mentalfloss.com “Why Does Our Hair Grow Darker as We Get Older?” 18/01/2021) Which substance is responsible of hair colour?
Correct Answer Message: Nel testo viene spiegato che la melanina è responsabile del colore degli occhi, dei capelli e della pelle.
Subject: Inglese

Question: It is possible that major stress can speed up the process of going gray, but it’s not necessarily because your melanocytes stop producing melanin. Stress—brought on by physical or psychological trauma, serious illness, extreme changes in diet or weight, hormonal fluctuations, etc.—can cause a condition called telogen effluvium, where your hair falls out as much as three times faster than usual. For middle-aged people, the new hair that replaces it might be gray, giving the impression that stress was the direct cause. That said, a 2020 study found that the fur of some mice exposed to stress turned gray for a different reason. When the mice were stressed—from exposure to a variation on capsaicin, which makes chili peppers hot—their sympathetic nerve cells produced noradrenaline. That, in turn, rapidly activated melanocytes and caused them to move away from their hair follicles. Without those melanocytes, the mice’s new fur grew in gray. In order to see if humans respond the same way, more study is needed. (Da mentalfloss.com “Why Does Our Hair Grow Darker as We Get Older?” 18/01/2021) What is telegen effluvium?
Option (a): A condition that causes to hair stop growing
Option (b): A condition that causes hair to fall faster than usual
Option (c): A condition that causes hair to grow faster
Option (d): A condition that causes hair to fall slower than usual
Option (e): A condition that causes hair colour to change
Correct Answer Message: La condizione sopra citata causa una maggior caduta dei capelli che, nel caso delle persone di mezza età, vengono sostituiti poi da capelli grigi.
Subject: Inglese

Question: The phrase mouth-watering is actually pretty accurate. There are two types of saliva: mucous and serous. Mucous saliva is exactly what it sounds like—thick, sticky, and full of mucus. Serous saliva, on the other hand, is nearly all water, and that’s what floods into your mouth at the smell, sight, or thought of especially delicious food. Making saliva is your body’s way of yelling excitedly about the food in front of you. WE ARE GOING TO EAT! says your brain. YES! WE ARE GOING TO EAT CAKE! agree your salivary glands, eagerly pumping spit into your mouth. (Da mentalfloss.com “Why Does Seeing Food Make Your Mouth Water?” 6/01/2021) Which are the types of saliva?
Correct Answer Message: Nel testo viene riportata l’esistenza di due tipi di saliva, una mucosa ed una sierosa, quest’ultima coinvolta nel momento in cui si percepisce l’odore, la vista o anche solo il pensiero di una pietanza particolarmente gustosa al nostro palato.
Subject: Inglese

Question: Way back when, the Romans had a god named Janus. He was the god of doors and gates and had two faces—one looking forward and one looking back. Julius Caesar thought it would be appropriate for January, Janus's namesake month, to be the doorway to a new year, and when he created the Julian calendar, he made January 1 the first day of the year (this also put the calendar year in line with the consular year, as new consuls also took office that day). For Caesar, the Julian calendar was a political tool and weapon. As the Roman armies conquered new lands, the Empire often gave its new subjects some freedom in retaining certain religious and social customs. After the calendar was created, though, it was used in every corner of the Empire, not just for consistency, but to remind all citizens of Roman authority and Caesar's power. (Da mentalfloss.com) “Why Does the New Year Start on January 1?” 1/01/2021) Why did all districts of Roman Empire use the Julian calendar?
Option (b): It was adopted for religious reasons
Option (c): To remind people when they became part of the Roman Empire
Option (d): To help people to conform to one culture
Correct Answer Message: L’utilizzo del calendario giuliano venne diffuso nei vari territori dell’impero romano allo scopo di sottolineare e ricordare ai territori conquistati l’autorità della figura di Cesare.
Subject: Inglese

Question: After Rome fell and Christianity spread through Europe, the celebration of the new year was seen as pagan (the Romans, after all, had observed the new year's first day by having in drunken orgies), so the first day of the year was moved to a more agreeable date to Christianize it. Some countries started their year on March 25, the day Christians commemorate the announcement to Mary that she miraculously was pregnant. Other countries used Christmas Day, December 25, and others used Easter Sunday, no matter what date it fell on. Often, this change only applied to the government calendar's. In common usage, January 1 was still the first day of the year, as regular non-clergy, non-royal folks didn't see a need to change it. (Da mentalfloss.com) “Why Does the New Year Start on January 1?” 1/01/2021) Which one of the following days has not been used as the first day of the year?
Correct Answer Message: Nel testo vengono citate alcune delle date che vennero adottate nel corso dei secoli per indicare l’inizio di un nuovo anno, l’8 dicembre non è tra queste.
Subject: Inglese

Question: This calendrical chaos worked for a while, but a frustrated pope would put an end to it during the Middle Ages. An error in Caesar's calendar had caused the Julian year to become misaligned with the solar year. By 1582, the difference had grown to 10 days. Over the years, the Spring Equinox (and, with it, Easter) kept getting moved up, and Pope Gregory XIII was tired of having to reset the holiday. Gregory devised a new calendar that used a single leap day every four years to keep it aligned. He also restored January 1 as the first day of the year. Most Catholic countries adopted the Gregorian calendar quickly, but the Protestant and Eastern Rite countries were a little more hesitant. The Protestants complained that the "Roman Antichrist" was trying to trick them into worshiping on the wrong days. The Eastern Rite churches wanted to maintain tradition, so some Eastern European countries kept the Julian calendar for centuries more. Russia didn't switch to the Gregorian calendar until after the 1917 revolution, and even today the Eastern Orthodox Church still follows either the traditional or revised Julian calendar to set its liturgical year. (Da mentalfloss.com) “Why Does the New Year Start on January 1?” 1/01/2021) Why did Pope Gregory XIII decide to change the Caesar’s calendar?
Option (b): It was shorter than the solar year
Option (c): It was misaligned with the solar year
Correct Answer Message: Il problema del calendario giuliano consisteva nel fatto che questo non coincidesse con l’anno solare. Col passare di anni e secoli si erano accumulati 10 giorni di differenza e, comportando questo il continuo spostamento dei festeggiamenti religiosi, il papa Gregorio XIII decise di correggerlo.
Subject: Inglese

Question: The Divine Comedy chronicles Dante’s journey through hell, where he is guided by the Italian poet Virgil and a woman named Beatrice through nine concentric circles of the afterlife, all based on different sins. The first circle is Limbo, the region for those who cannot go to heaven simply because they have not been baptized, or were born before Jesus Christ. The entire poem totals 14,233 lines, longer than The Odyssey (12,110 lines) but shorter than The Iliad (15,693 lines). For this poem, Dante notably used the terza rima style, which is when stanzas are split into three lines, with the first and third lines ending in a rhyme and the second line rhyming with the first and third lines of the following stanzas (aba, bcb, cdc … yzy, z). (Da mentalfloss.com) Which is the longest poem?
Correct Answer Message: Le ultime due alternative non sono presenti nel testo. Delle restanti, il poema più lungo è l’Iliade, il cui numero esatto di versi è riportato nel testo.
Subject: Inglese

Question: In 1302, Dante found himself the victim of what historians have deemed "trumped-up charges" of embezzlement, opposition to the pope, and more by the Florentine government. When he refused to appear to answer for his crimes and pay a fine, it was decided that should he ever step foot in Florence again, he would be burned alive. As a result, Dante spent his remaining years as a wanderer, a lifestyle that afforded him the inspiration to write The Divine Comedy. In 2008, Florence’s city council voted to symbolically revoke Dante’s death sentence in the city and restore his honor. (Da mentalfloss.com) When did the city of Florence vote to restore Dante’s honour?
Correct Answer Message: Il consiglio della città di Firenze si riunì nel 2008 per revocare la sentenza di morte che venne emessa contro Dante nel 1302 e ristabilirne così l’onore dopo più di 700 anni.
Subject: Inglese

Question: If we think to the Italian words like rinascente, tramezzino or the name Ornella we can’t find anything the may have in common. D’Annunzio is the father of a lot of words that have been added to the Italian dictionary and language, other words are also scudetto, fusoliera and vigili del fuoco.
